immutable_prompts.description: My ultimate goal is to one day build an underwater city, and I am focused on collecting the skills, connecting with people, and understanding the resources necessary to achieve this. I am deeply interested in the multidisciplinary aspects of creating and inhabiting underwater environments. This encompasses robotics for subsea construction and maintenance, the unique challenges of underwater architecture and structural engineering, and innovations in materials science like 3D concrete printing for marine applications. My interests also include the geology of the underwater world, the integration of marine ecosystems (including diverse fish populations) with human-made structures, and the human experience of exploring these environments through scuba diving and freediving. I am keen on learning about seasteading concepts and practical implementations as potential pathways or related endeavors. I'm looking for technical papers, case studies, project proposals, and discussions that contribute to this long-term vision.

mutable_prompts.description:
Current Focus: Gaining immediate hands-on experience with underwater volcanoes, undersea habitats, ROVs, and submersibles in the US, prioritizing access through relevant US-based groups and universities.  Emphasis on practical application and direct engagement.

Key Interests:  US universities and organizations with active programs in underwater volcano research, undersea habitat design, and ROV/submersible technology; US-based meetups and scuba events related to underwater robotics and habitats; identifying and connecting with individuals and groups actively involved in underwater habitat design and ROV/submersible operation; locating and accessing resources (courses, workshops, internships) at US universities with strong ocean engineering programs relevant to underwater volcanology and submersible technology.

Immediate Priorities: Identifying and applying to relevant US university programs; directly contacting US-based organizations conducting research in underwater volcanology, habitat design, and ROV/submersible technology; attending relevant diving/scuba events and technical meetups to network; actively seeking mentorship and collaboration opportunities with experts.

Research Priorities: ROV and submersible applications in deep-sea volcanic environments; the design, construction, and operation of undersea habitats; practical submersible and ROV operation and maintenance; identifying key personnel and active research projects at US universities and organizations offering hands-on opportunities.  Focus on practical training and experience in underwater volcanoes, undersea habitats, ROVs/submersibles.

Further Exploration: Locating and contacting US-based diving, technical, and academic event organizers; actively pursuing hands-on ROV and submersible experience; expanding networking within the US underwater robotics and habitat design communities.
